page.title: 06H.M.S.ROYAL ARTHUR,CORSHAM
page.content: H.M.S Royal Arthur is not a ship but a land base for training sailors and Petty Offices for leadership. The Commander is in charge of training. There are 102 sailors and some civilians who work there. Some live on the base,others in Corsham. The assault courses are to train leaders. They also have lectures and parade drills. This all takes on average 10 hours a day. They start work at 8am. They train for 2,3 or 4 weeks and then go back to sea. The base covers 450m x250m,is all above ground and was built in 1939. In 1945 it was used as a Polish Refugee Camp and the Navy took over in 1947. One of the first officers to work at the Royal Arthur in 1947 was Prince Philip,the Duke of Edinburgh. There are 36 buildings in all,including classrooms and offices.
